title: Shein: The secretive Chinese brand dressing Gen Z
description: Shein's popularity has shot up during the pandemic, targeting young shoppers with low-cost products.

title: Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala ties the knot in nikkah ceremony
description: The activist and her partner Asser Malik celebrate a nikkah ceremony with family in Birmingham.

title: Raducanu loses in Austria and announces Beltz as new coach
description: US Open champion Emma Raducanu's season ends with defeat in her opening match in Linz and she confirms Torben Beltz's appointment as her new coach.

title: Marie Antoinette's bracelets sell at auction for $8m
description: Two diamond bracelets once owned by the queen of France were sold to an anonymous telephone bidder.

title: Fury 'badly injured' before Wilder fight, says his father
description: World heavyweight champion Tyson Fury has had surgery after suffering a serious injury before his second win over Deontay Wilder, says his father.

title: Large section of cliff collapses at West Bay on Jurassic Coast
description: The Environment Agency footage shows the large rock fall on Dorset's Jurassic Coast.

title: Climate change: What are the big polluters doing to cut carbon emissions?
description: The top emissions-producing nations all have plans to tackle global warming, but what progress are they making?

title: Emily Ratajkowski: Told to 'get ugly' for acting roles
description: In an interview with BBC Newsnight, she also spoke about her alleged sexual assault by Robin Thicke.

title: Glastonbury Festival 2022: Diana Ross coming back to play legend slot
description: The soul icon joins Billie Eilish on the bill, as the festival returns for the first time since 2019.

title: My Day at COP26: 'It's like a never-ending airport terminal'
description: Science journalist, Helen Briggs, is at COP26 to report for the BBC - she describes what life is like behind the scenes at the Glasgow summit.

title: England & New Zealand gear up for T20 World Cup semi-final - the key battles to look out for
description: As England prepare to face New Zealand in the T20 World Cup semi-finals on Wednesday, BBC Sport looks at where the match could be won.

title: How much nuclear power does the UK use and is it safe?
description: Nuclear power is being promoted as a source of 'clean' energy, but is it safe?

title: Toxic foam covers sacred Yamuna river in India
description: Hindu devotees are filmed bathing in the Yamuna river to mark the Chhath Puja religious festival.

title: Chinese takeaway trial: Man found guilty of murdering girl
description: Chun Xu convicted of murdering Wenjing Lin, 16, after a jury heard he 'wanted revenge on her mother'.

title: Caerphilly dog attack: Mum's tribute to 'sweet' boy who died
description: The mother of 10-year-old Jack Lis describes him as "our sweet, sweet boy".

title: Cladding: Why is it unsafe and what money has the government promised?
description: The housing secretary is unhappy at leaseholders being asked to cover the costs of repairs.

title: Second jobs: Voters decide if MPs have right priorities, says Dominic Raab
description: Amid questions about Geoffrey Cox's work outside Westminster, the deputy PM defends his fellow Tory MP.

title: Covid-19: Vaccines to be compulsory for frontline NHS staff in England
description: Whitehall sources tell the BBC frontline staff will have until the spring to get fully vaccinated.

title: Ferdinand says it might be time for Solskjaer 'to hand on the baton'
description: Rio Ferdinand questions Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's future as Manchester United boss, calling on his former team-mate to leave the club with his "head held high".

title: England prospect Wong stars with bat and ball in Women's Big Bash
description: Issy Wong smashes 43 off 17 balls and stars with the ball but still ends up on the losing side in the Women's Big Bash League.

title: Belarus migrants: Poland fears armed border escalation
description: The warning comes after hundreds of migrants tried to cut a fence to enter Poland illegally.

title: Thousands of UK phone boxes to be saved from closure
description: About 5,000 phone boxes around the UK will be kept open if they fulfil certain criteria, says Ofcom.

title: Rangers boss Gerrard high on Villa manager shortlist
description: Rangers manager Steven Gerrard remains high on Aston Villa's list of potential targets to replace Dean Smith - but other contenders are still under discussion.

title: Sierra Leone tanker explosion: Survivors try to rebuild lives
description: Survivors are left wondering how to rebuild their lives after Sierra Leone's tanker explosion.

title: Primark admits struggles with rising costs
description: The fashion retailer's annual sales are down 12% on pre-Covid levels, latest results show.

title: Rolls-Royce gets funding to develop mini nuclear reactors
description: Private investors and the UK government will help fund the firm's development of small nuclear reactors.

title: Ireland can beat All Blacks and Gibson-Park must start over Murray - O'Sullivan
description: Former Ireland coach Eddie O'Sullivan believes Andy Farrell's side have genuine prospects of defeating the All Blacks this weekend in Dublin.

title: Nagaenthran: Family prays for miracle to halt execution of man with low IQ
description: The drug trafficking case has sparked a rare disquiet in Singapore where the death penalty is largely uncontroversial.

title: Match of the Day Top 10: Micah Richards asks Gary Lineker and Alan Shearer who was better
description: Micah Richards asks his Match of the Day Top 10 colleagues Gary Lineker and Alan Shearer which of the two legendary goalscorers was actually the better player.

title: The Papers: PM skips 'sleaze showdown' and MP's tax haven job
description: The front pages feature the continuing debate over MPs' outside jobs, lobbying and standards.

title: California couple sue clinic for alleged IVF swap 'horror'
description: Two California couples gave birth to each others’ babies after a mix-up at a fertility clinic , a lawsuit claims.

title: What do scientists actually want?
description: We asked climate experts from around the world what they want to see agreed at COP26 this week.

title: Regular 10pm bedtime linked to lower heart risk
description: Synchronising sleep to match our internal body clock appears to be good for the heart, claim scientists.

title: Scenes of joy as first visitors arrive in US after 20-month ban
description: There are tears, hugs and balloons galore as the first international visitors arrive in US airports.

title: Emotional families reunite at airport as US lifts travel ban
description: The first intercontinental flights arrived at the John F Kennedy Airport today. As families gleefully reunited, many were meeting new relatives for the first time.

title: The photographer fighting to keep the America's wild horses wild
description: A photographer is using her art to inspire, hoping to keep the iconic animals at home on the range.

title: Travis Scott festival tragedy: Were warning signs missed at Astroworld?
description: Concerns were raised before Travis Scott's fatal festival show. Could the tragedy have been averted?

title: Desperate Afghans turn to people smugglers for help fleeing the country
description: Smugglers tell the BBC the number of Afghans leaving has more than doubled since the Taliban takeover.

title: One smart idea to reduce wood waste in construction
description: A new system is being launched to allow builders to reuse wooden pallets multiple times.

title: FA Cup: Wimbledon's storied Plough Lane past and the new chapter being written
description: The FA Cup has a special place in Wimbledon's remarkable history. On Saturday, fans could finally witness its return to Plough Lane.
